intro: Lampranthus vanzijliae, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it store water, adapting it to arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a desirable ornamental plant.
